revised_title: Space Science and Technology: Launching Facilities and Payload Capabilities
tldr: This article discusses the various launching facilities and payload capabilities available for space science and technology during the 1970s. It covers the range of launching vehicles, their costs, and the types of orbits they can achieve. The article also highlights the importance of launch site locations and the development of new launch sites in French Guiana and Europe. It provides an overview of the payload capabilities of various countries, including the United States, Russia, and Europe, and suggests that a wide range of possibilities exist for launching substantial payloads within the next decade.
